intro: Stenogyne calaminthoides, commonly known as the Hawaiian stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in coastal and lowland areas. It has small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
